LC,
 
They not only see a bigger picture but have set all the wheels for i=
t in motion.
These new rapid developments are not pure chance or coincidenc=
e.
We as researchers and developers have been set on a path and we will fol=
low it until our job
is done.
 
Bruce
Bruce Halliday 


To: EVP-ITC@yahoogr=
oups.comFrom: lcdupla@...: Thu, 20 Dec 2007 00:51:14 +0000Subject=
: [EVP-ITC] Re: Thanks and more stuff




Perhaps those on the other side a=
re more urgent, anxious and excited about the box breakthroughs than even w=
e are. Could it be because they see a bigger picture coming to pass?- LC---=
 In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, "psi_research" <vilhellm@...> wrote:>> Hi Ursu=
la,> > There is a certain urgency to Box messages - sort of like they need =
> to convey quickly. The same thing happens in video ITC, it's like > there=
 is but a moment and we all better pay attention. -Bill> > --- In EVP-ITC@y=
ahoogroups.com, Ursula Bielski <ursulabielski@> > wrote:> >> > Willy, Reall=
y interested in listening to the new files. I'll let > you know after.> > J=
ust to throw in regarding EVP maker and everything else but the > boxes. I =
used EVP maker and the water method AND foreign language > broadcast method=
 and radio static and box fan, etc etc etc before I > got my shack hack and=
 my Joe's box, and I must admit that I have put > everything else aside eve=
n though I got good results with ALL of > those other methods. There's just=
 something very exciting about the > boxes, I think, that makes us forsake =
all others. When I started > using a hack, which Jeff Rezman made for me be=
fore I got the Joe's > Box, I felt it was a nervous sort of experimentation=
--that is to say, > the loud, short, fast sound clips had me on edge, as I =
was used to > quiet static and water, but I think now I'm addicted to the s=
ound and > the frenzy of it! Does anyone else feel this way?> > Ursula> > >=
 > billliscomb williscomb@ wrote:> > Ursula and Misty =96 thank you very mu=
ch for your feedback. > I > > really appreciate you taking the time to list=
en, and for the > > comments, especially noting the dual layers of speech. =
Interesting. > > Frank S. - Thanks for the recent files from EVPmaker - nic=
e! > > There hasn't been much discussion regarding EVPmaker lately, so I > =
> wasn't' sure if it was a viable tool to use. I haven't read many > > olde=
r posts, but hope to get caught up during the holidays. Have > you > > or o=
thers considered modifying speech synthesis software to > generate > > rand=
om sounds? I wonder how something like that would work=85> > On the 16th I =
did three 3minute recordings and got 9 clips from > > them. In this session=
, I was asking questions regarding a knocking > > sound I heard while going=
 to sleep or waking up about 12 years ago. > > My life situation wasn't the=
 best at that time. It was always three > > knocks, and once a doorbell, bu=
t not the doorbell for where I was > > then living. Started the Knocking se=
ssion by telling "Rick" that I > > got messages from previous session, got =
"Well, he's got patience!" > > for response. Then was told, "Aye, it smells=
 in here." Next asked > > them what sound did I hear back then, and got "it=
 was knocking > (maybe > > nothing?)" The best one so far is; "Our earthbou=
nd forefathers are > > video programs." A second voice keeps repeating "Ent=
" syllable > > during this one. I have put these files in a new folder call=
ed > > Knocking, which is under Laptop MP3s. More comments there. > > I'm m=
aking progress on getting the software needed to do > > linear scanning wit=
h the Radio Shark 2 USB am/fm radio and hope to > > have it up and running =
within the next week or two. > > Thanks again to all> > Willy> >>
